summary: This bill, the Apostle Islands National Park and Preserve Act (H.R. 5497), designates the Apostle Islands National Lakeshore as the Apostle Islands National Park and Preserve. It outlines the boundaries of the park and preserve, details administration by the Secretary of the Interior, and addresses hunting, fishing, and trapping regulations. The bill also mandates interpretive features at visitor centers and clarifies that the act does not affect treaty rights of Indigenous communities.
